Posts.Title: Any serious bakers out there? Need help with mixer advice ktym hugz4u

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2010 04:06PM KittyDog wrote: I too understand that fear. I have had four surgeries since Jan. 09.  I remember nothing on any of them.  I told the Dr. I did not want to remember going into the ER.  So when it was time to leave pre-op, I got a dose of VERSED.  I don't remember leaving the room on my last surgery.  With my MX, I saw the OR lights and that was it.  Tell them your fears and you don't want to know and they can take care of that. With my MX, I woke up in my room groggy.  With my Hysterectomy, I woke up in recovery first and don't remember much other than telling me to breath.  lol  So I couldn't do that to their liking so I went to my room on oxygen.  With my gallbladder since it was outpatient.  I woke up in pain and until I breathed deep enough for them, no pain meds where allowed until I could control my breathing with oxygen.  So it all depends on your hospital, nurse, and Dr.s.  good luck

I am also scared out of my mind about the possibilities of cellulitis.  Thank you Lord that I have very short fingernail thanks to chemo.  They all fell off and now I can't stand them to get long because they make my fingers hurt.  Darn that may be the neuropathy but at least they are short and I can't do to much tissue damage from all the scratching.  Now the pencil eraser is another story.

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2010 06:31AM KittyDog wrote: Thanks all. I went to my appointment this morning and the therapist wouldn't do anything since I was still broken out.  So she called my Dr. and set up an appointment.  She nor my Dr.'s office thinks it is the lotion or anything to do with the bandages.  Get this one....they think it is my FOOB.  I just got it Wed. afternoon.  I wore it all day yesterday for the first time.  I wore it to my appointment and the therapist made me take it out.  In that little bit of time I had already started breaking out on that shoulder and my back. Gee I don't know.  Sniff sniff.  but I took it off and I am getting ready to take some benadryl Dr.'s orders.  She also gave me a prescription for Cipro just encase it should turn towards cellulits.  So I will be sleeping soon.  lol   Thanks again.   ssss
Posts.Title: awww....HELP KittyDog Binney4

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2010 04:55AM KittyDog wrote: I am using Cortizone 1% on it.  The rash is not better today and I actually have some break out on my hand now.  I am going to call them back in the morning. That is why I did the pictures.  It is much easier to tell me that it doesn't look like cellulitis too.  I still worry about getting it with all the scratching.  The worst part is trying to figure out what caused it.  I am going to look for that vanicream after the stores open up.  We still have blue laws here and store can't open till after 1pm on Sundays.  My DH says I should put the sleeve layer on my other arm, the next layer on my leg and then put a bandage on the other one and see if I break out.  My theory is still the lotion because everywhere I itch is where she massaged but I am not the professional here.    My LE T said that she can not do anything as long as I have a rash.  I will have to go tomorrow anyway to return her LE book. Thanks again for all your help.  Nothing like a newbie with so many problems.

Posts.Content: May 31, 2014 04:23AM KittyDog wrote: I went to check it out to see if the torso one would fit me.  Found it interesting that they added this in their description.   I think next pay day I may order one and find out.  You have made some progress at least.   This product has also gained in popularity for many cancer survivors because of the soft comfortable support it gives without underwires, the compression which helps with trunkal edema*, and for a varitey of post surgical* reasons including but not limited to liposuction, tummy tuck, back surgeries and even lung surgery*.
Posts.Title: GARMENT for truncal purple32 Binney4

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2011 08:26PM KittyDog wrote: While on taxol, I discovered I could eat egg salad. Grant it I only ate half a sandwich with the crust cut off but it made my family happy.  I also discovered sherbet taste great while in the hospital.  Just recently I attended a Lymphedema support meeting and out dietitian from the hospital was the speaker.  Oh joy I had to confess she saw me and I sent every one of her nasty ice creams and  boost back.  One of the things she said she discovered on her own due to sickness was that cold stuff taste better and you tend to keep it down longer.  That might be why I did well with the egg salad and why I loved the sherbet.  I could not get the ensure down. Then just so you know it does get better.  My loss of appetite did return after I finished radiation.  It came back slowly and even today there are certain foods I can't stand the swell, look or taste of.  Hang in there.
Posts.Title: Ensure, Boost and the Like anonymice sandpiper

Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2010 07:53PM KittyDog wrote: After doing some reading tonight on the Bellisse sight, I am looking forward to getting my compression bra on Tuesday.  I was suppose to see my Therapist Friday and get it but I was sick and cancelled my appointment.   My upper arm is swollen and it is awful under my arm.  I am sure the sinus infection is playing a role in my swelling.  When I first started having problems I also had a sinus infection but thought the PT for my torn rotator cuff was the main reason.  Now I know.   So there I am happy to see the therapist and get my bra. Who what have thought I would be happy over that!

Posts.Title: Hello, Goodby, Ovaries montana7p Pure

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2010 05:49PM KittyDog wrote: My bandages are made by Roaidal. As I was laying in bed thinking to myself what if its mets. I had to think serious about the last time I broke out.  Which was after radiation.  My radiation oncologist thought it was an allergic reaction to the cream or the Aquaphor he had me using. To be safe he had me quit them and change laundry detergent.  I got to thinking.....Aquaphor is made by Eucerin and my Therapist is using a Eucerin lotion on her hands and me.  I looked up the ingredients and the one I think she is using has three of the same ingredients in it as Aquaphor.  Hopefully this is it since the rash on my chest is looks the same  as the one on my arm now . On  the positive side of this my arm is down and I don't feel like their is something under my arm.  I do feel tight across the chest though but I am not giving up!

Posts.Title: Preventing mosquito bites? moogie BeckySharp

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2011 04:47PM KittyDog wrote: I have not been bitten on my LE side yet.  I did get three flea bites on the truncal side and they did not get as bad as they normally do.  My body reacts to mosquito's that way all the time.  If I have to be out it is long pants and I spray the DEET stuff.  They are horrible here too.  My DH let some in coming in last week and I got bit 5 times on the leg that was not on the couch.  covered up.  We have chiggers, and these horrible sand fleas.  I don't know what they are really called but that is what we always called it.  They itch like crazy and swell up fist size for days.  The more you scratch them the worse they get.  So I stay inside!

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2015 04:40AM KittyDog wrote: Sadly I have not been able to wear my new sleeve I got in December. I have been dealing with hives again. Arm is okay right now but just a wee bit puff under the arm at the top but chest sure does hurt and is swollen with the latest round of hives. Any advice for dealing with LE and hives? I also had another biopsy done two weeks ago. Negative for cancer and it shows I am dealing with hives. lol I could have told them that without cutting on me. They were almost better until I saw the dermatologist for the biopsy. They gave me samples of Topicort and a perscription. I learned a hard lesson...never trust your Dr. when prescribing creams. The sample were for cream and I used them first. It had lanolin in it and I am highly allergic to lanolin. grrr so going on week two of this break out. I already know I need to get back doing MLD but chest hurts still from the biopsy.

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2013 11:18PM KittyDog wrote: In my LE arm, I also have a torn rotator cuff that happen during my radiation treatments. This summer when the swelling went up the neck and back of the shoulder, I had major problems with that arm. I couldn't put it behind my back at all. It hurt to raise it. After the two weeks of wrapping I got back most of my limited movement. My shoulder is frozen but not bad. I still can tell when I am really swollen in the shoulder because I start hurting with movement. I don't think you are crazy but we both might be crazy together! :)

Posts.Title: ALL THINGS Gloves and sleeves purple32 tsoebbin

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 03:25PM KittyDog wrote: My oncologist and gyn recommended taking it all.  I was strongly ER and PR for my cancer.   Also despite not having period in a year and half, my FSH level was still at a 20.  Lot of estrogen floating around in there.  It has now been two months since mine and I feel better than I have in a long time.  Surgery was easy even for me.  I was in the hospital one night and only took 27 Loritabs and that was mainly at night to sleep.  lol  I have been on Femara for four weeks now.  My only side effect has been some mild joint pain and one hot flash.  I can't complain yet.  For me, I would be more scared of the cancer returning than the side effects that can occur from not having my ovaries.   Good Luck with your decision.   I know you have been struggling with it for a while.
Posts.Title: Question for ER+ ladies.... Fearless_One Fearless_One

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2011 08:06PM KittyDog wrote: Just wanted to say I too was one that burned horrible.  It too shall pass in a couple of weeks.  I finished treatment on July 2 and by the last week in July I was on the beach!  I had a 7 year old and I don't know how you are doing it with a one year old.  Bless your heart.  Wishing you a fast recovery.

Posts.Content: Sep 24, 2010 04:47PM KittyDog wrote: I understand your frustration.  It just doesn't ever seem to end for me either.  I have had so many things go wrong since my DX the latest being the allergic reaction to something.  I have found that I do feel better taking a small dose of xanax at night.  My lovely chemo brain forgot I was out of it last week...use a weekly pill container...and I started breaking down and crying about everything again.  It is too easy to get caught up in our grief but we must push on and learn to laugh.  I hope you find something that works for the pain.  Thinking about you and hoping you have a better week.
